basics.name: Jeffrey Rabovsky
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I love building software and have been doing so professionally since 2011. I studied Electrical Engineering at the University of Iowa, where I also ended up with minors in Math and Computer Science. In school I was interested in microcontrollers and embedded systems, but since then I've been focused on building reliable and scalabe backend systems.

work.summary: Lead development teams in ensuring application scalability, performance, and availability
highlights: Built and maintained monitoring, alerting, and deployment automation for three software development teams
Developed a tool for administering the access of internal tools to more than 2000 Customer Care Agents and Delivery Operations Specialists
Added functionality to Garçon CLI, a Python tool built on top of the Cement Framework, allowing for System Administrators to perform high-level operations on the Orders and Customer Care APIs
Lead the integration of Amazon Aurora and S3 with Care-Metrics, a system for recording and displaying real-time metrics from Grubhub's customer care CRM
Contributed to the development of a CherryPy UI for displaying microservice configuration, routing, and authorization

work.summary: Operated and built tooling for scalable cloud-based web platforms
highlights: Built automation to scale down the legacy V7 Alex platform, saving over $12,000 monthly
Developed features for the V8 Portal, an internal Rails/ReactJS application allowing for non-technical users to build and deploy content
Lead the migration of the V8 Portal from legacy Ansible playbooks to AWS Elastic Beanstalk, allowing for automated zero-downtime deployments
Wrote Jellyvision's first open source ruby gem: leeroy_jenkins, a CLI tool for managing Jenkins job configurations
Built and maintained Jellyvision's internal RubyGems server

work.summary: Collaborated with development and operations teams to build automation and improve cloud infrastructure utilization
highlights: Prototyped AWS DynamoDB as a more cost effective alternative to non-managed NoSQL databases
Developed Chef cookbooks to automate the installation and configuration of IIS and ASP.NET MVC applications
Built a Ruby on Rails application for managing Windows services on over 900 machines
Wrote PowerShell scripts to automate monitoring configuration changes through Zenoss’ API
Using the AWS Ruby SDK and Thor, built a CLI application to automate backups and tagging of EC2 instances

work.summary: Built automation as part of a team that led a large software development organization into a DevOps model
highlights: Developed Chef cookbooks to automate the installation and configuration of collectd, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and MySQL
Built automation, using the AWS Ruby SDK, to delete unutilized EC2 instances, EBS volumes, and ELBs

Using Chef and the AWS Ruby SDK, lead the development of a CLI tool to automate the provisioning, maintenance, reporting, and decommissioning of entire AWS environments consisting of over 1500 total EC2 instances
Developed a tool, using the AWS Ruby SDK, to enforce multi-factor authentication, to enforce API key rotation, and to monitor service usage limits of AWS accounts

work.summary: Collaborated with a multidisciplinary research team developing Santos, a predictive human modeling tool
highlights: Implemented algorithms with C++ for calculating joint torques based on data from biomechanical research
Built GUIs for interacting with and visualizing data within Santos using C# and Windows Forms
Assisted in teaching a graduate course in predictive human modeling
Lead training of interns in C++, forward/inverse kinematics, optimization methods, and the Virtools 3D library

work.summary: Conducted field verification and assisted in electrical systems commissioning
highlights: Documented occupancy sensors, lighting fixtures, and electrical ballasts of 11 buildings in downtown Iowa City
